feedback.Physical object: Included — A bounded, tangible geological object with discrete form.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Excluded — Naturally occurring; not fabricated or designed.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — Not inherently biological or derived from biological models.
feedback.Fixed/static: Excluded — Once extracted, it is mobile and not fixed in position.
feedback.Structural: Excluded — Plays no structural role in its isolated form.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — It can be seen and touched without tools; directly observable.
feedback.Material form: Included — It has physical substance, mass, and a coherent shape.
feedback.Passive: Included — Exhibits no agency or intrinsic behavior; only reacts under external forces.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Excluded — It was not designed or created for a purpose.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — It does not emit or produce effects independently.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — No computational, regulatory, or signaling function.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — No autonomous state change; any reaction is passive.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Any interaction is contextual, not a built-in interface.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Once removed from geological context, it is isolated.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — Has no function, behavior, or system role.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Not essential to any defined system by default.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — Not symbolic unless framed externally.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Does not carry or transmit information intrinsically.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Not governed by internal symbolic or operational logic.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Lacks designed subsystems or modularity.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — Does not influence behavior directly.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — It is not a model or concept about concepts.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Temporal existence is not abstracted into its identity.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — It is a concrete material entity, not an abstraction.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Its meaning emerges from context, not construction.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Classification is extrinsic, not inherent.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Not tied to a role or personal identity.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — No rules or systems intrinsically govern it.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — It is not itself a semantic or symbolic unit.
feedback.Visible: Excluded — Subsumed by 'Perceptible'; not a socially visible role.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Maintains identity across different contexts.
feedback.Widely known: Excluded — Known only in specialist or scientific domains.

encoding_notes: This encoding treats the Mars rock sample as a physical geological object, isolated from institutional, symbolic, or scientific contexts. Perceptible and Passive are now correctly included: it can be directly sensed and exhibits no agency or internal behavior. All functional, abstract, and social traits remain excluded under this narrow, intrinsic framing.
